properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: 30 to 50 mm of rain possible tonight into Tuesday morning Rain will start later today and become heavy sometime after midnight. Total rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 mm locally are possible by late Tuesday morning. Rainfall warning might be required. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District Office. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-09-29T01:14:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-09-28T09:15:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2966986298.2020
Area: Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intense Pacific weather system will continue to spread heavy rain to the north coast, specifically the Kitimat region. The heavy rain has moved out of the Stewart and Terrace areas. Storm total rainfall amounts across the inland regions of the North coast have reached 50 to 70 mm. The heavy rain at Kitimat will taper off to a few showers by early to mid morning as the system weakens. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-09-28T22:59:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-09-28T14:32:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2315238224.2020
Area: North Coast - inland including Kitimat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A deep Gulf of Alaska low is moving inland over Alaska today, sending a strong frontal system across the Yukon. South to southwest winds of 40 to 60 km/h with gusts to 90 are expected over the South Klondike Highway, the Haines Road and the town of Haines Junction this afternoon. Over the South Klondike Highway the strongest winds will occur near White Pass. Over the Haines Road the strongest winds will be north of Chilkat Pass and near the town of Haines junction. Winds will start to ease late this afternoon. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-09-29T03:44:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-09-28T17:37:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3968576148.2020
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp, South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass, Haines Junction
